Top Materials for Long-Lasting Commercial Overhead Doors
Oxfordshire Eco-Composite Powers GR Supra in Australia
items.summary:
- Oxfordshire's *BAMD Composites* supplied *eco-composite* body panels for *Toyota Gazoo Racing Australia*'s GR Supra Supercar, debuting in the 2026 Australian Supercars Championship.
- Designed, *tooled* and manufactured entirely at BAMD’s Oxfordshire facility, the project completed in 12 weeks from concept to race-ready panels, with significant CO₂ reductions versus traditional epoxy and pre-preg carbon.
- *Toyota Gazoo Racing Australia* selected BAMD for end-to-end, right-first-time capabilities, highlighting UK engineering leadership and expanding skilled local jobs as panels ship from the UK to Australia for 2025–26 testing.

items.title: Tariffs push carmakers to seek US suppliers face to face
items.summary:
- Tariffs and supply-chain pressure push automakers toward *US-made parts*, reshaping sourcing with tariff effects of up to **25%** on many components.
- The conference's speed-dating format connects more than 180 suppliers with automakers, highlighting imported-component costs rising as much as **50%** and a push for domestic partnerships.
- In-person meetings aim to build *trust* and regulatory alignment for long-term supply-chain resilience, as seen with the Mazda Toyota Alabama plant.

items.title: Merck doubles down on US soil with $70B investment strategy
Rivian trims workforce, preserves factory for R2 SUV
items.summary:
- *Rivian announced a 4.5% workforce reduction*, about *600-700 roles*, mainly in non‑manufacturing areas, while factory jobs in Normal, Illinois are spared. 
- The cuts are part of a broader cost‑cutting and go‑to‑market realignment, with marketing consolidated under a single unit and CEO *R. J. Scaringe* serving as interim chief marketing officer. 
- Rivian plans to begin production of the *R2* in early *2026* at a starting price of *$45,000*, while keeping its manufacturing capacity intact to support long‑term growth.

items.title: Manufacturing activity edges up as domestic demand drives growth
items.summary:
- *US manufacturing activity* ticked higher in October, led by stronger *domestic orders* as the PMI rose to **52.2**.
- Exports weakened while input-cost pressures persisted, keeping *pricing power* limited and squeezing margins.
- Despite a composite PMI uptick, sentiment fell amid government shutdown and policy uncertainty, underscoring the need for agile sourcing and cost containment.

items.title: Payroll intelligence for the agentic era
DOE axes $700M in manufacturing projects, reversing industrial policy momentum
Faulty camera system triggers massive Ford truck recall
items.summary:
- Ford recalls over 290,000 Super Duty trucks for a *rearview camera defect* that may fail in certain *lighting conditions*, reducing *visibility*. 
- The issue stems from the image processing module; Ford will release a *software update* with interim notices on Oct 20 and a full fix by **March 2026** at no cost. 
- The recall highlights how increasing vehicle digitization spreads risk to software and could attract greater regulatory scrutiny.

items.title: GM faces $1.6 Billion EV setback as market shifts
OpenAI teams with Broadcom to build AI chips
items.summary:
- OpenAI and **Broadcom** announce a multi-year partnership to build *custom AI accelerators*, aiming for up to 10 gigawatts of computing capacity.
- Racks will deploy from 2026 to 2029, delivering an end-to-end solution with *Ethernet*, PCIe, and optical tech, underscoring *vertical integration* in AI infra.
- The move could reshape manufacturing by letting AI firms own more hardware, potentially serving as a blueprint for others, backed by OpenAI’s >800M weekly users.

items.title: 737 Max production climbs as FAA signals Boeing confidence
items.summary:
- The **FAA** approved increasing *737 Max* monthly output from 38 to 42 jets, signaling confidence in Boeing's recovery.
- Regulators noted extensive reviews of the *Renton* assembly lines and maintained floor oversight following the Alaska incident.
- The move supports Boeing's plan to improve cash flow and deliveries ahead of earnings due Oct 29 amid ongoing supply-chain volatility.

items.title: Protected: How Can Aerospace Manufacturers Fast-Track ISO Compliance?
Ypsomed Opens $220M US Facility in NC
items.summary:
- Ypsomed’s **$220M** US plant in Holly Springs, NC will manufacture self-injection drug-delivery systems, with operations starting by 2027.
- Initial workforce around *100*, rising to about *200*, creating a domestic production base to strengthen supply chains.
- The expansion forms part of a tri-continental footprint (US/China/Switzerland) near the **Research Triangle** life sciences cluster.

items.title: Airbus doubles Mobile A320 capacity
items.summary:
- Airbus opens a second A320 final assembly line in Mobile, doubling capacity and targeting a 75 aircraft per month rate by 2027 to better serve US customers.
- The expansion adds 350,000 sq ft, ~1,000 new jobs (to ~3,000), and strengthens US suppliers and logistics near end users.
- The move highlights *reshoring*, *regionalization*, and the rise of *digital manufacturing* (5G, data‑driven processes) for greater supply-chain resilience.

items.title: Whirlpool expands Ohio plants with $300M investment
items.summary:
- Whirlpool commits a *$300 million* expansion to U.S. laundry production, expanding *Clyde* and *Marion* plants and creating *400–600 jobs*. 
- The plan reinforces Whirlpool's status as a *US-headquartered* company with a high share of products made in American factories and *domestic steel sourcing*, signaling a broader shift toward resilience and nearshoring. 
- Beyond incentives from JobsOhio, the expansion aligns with a trend toward *energy-efficient*, *connected appliances* and a *long-term strategy* to anchor manufacturing in the U.S.

items.title: Stellantis bets big on America with $13 billion investment
items.summary:
- **Stellantis** commits **$13B** to expand US production, creating over *5,000* jobs across *Illinois, Ohio, Michigan and Indiana* as it launches **five** new vehicles and refreshes **19** models.
- The plan centers on reopening the Belvidere, IL Jeep plant in 2027, creating about *3,300* jobs and signaling renewed domestic assembly.
- EV and engine expansion follows in Warren (MI) for a large SUV by 2028, Detroit for the next-gen Dodge Durango by 2029, and Kokomo (IN) for the GMET4 EVO engine from 2026, adding hundreds of jobs.

items.title: Intel’s 18A node powers America’s chipmaking revival
Manufacturing growth demands patient, long-term policymaking
GSK outlines $30B US push in R&D and manufacturing
items.summary:
- *GSK* commits about **$30B** over five years to expand US *R&D*, modernize the supply chain, and accelerate biologics with *AI-driven* tech to boost domestic capacity.
- Pennsylvania advances include a planned Upper Merion biologics 'flex' factory and an **$800M** Marietta expansion, with five sites upgraded and hundreds of high-skilled jobs.
- The plan prioritizes digital integration and AI for automation and real-time data to accelerate development, improve yield, and boost US supply resilience.

For Berner International, the door is open to smarter technology and more sustainable operations
Pamarco’s laser-engraved anilox rolls meter ink with unparalleled precision for high-speed printing solutions
Manufacturing recovery meets headwinds from costs and policy
items.summary:
- US manufacturing showed tentative stabilization in September with the ISM *PMI* at 49.1, but the sector remains in contraction for a seventh month.
- Rising *tariffs*, input price inflation and shipping delays are raising costs and prompting nearshoring, supplier reshuffling and higher inventories.
- Employment is weak as firms delay hiring and speed *automation* and outsourcing; modest 2025 revenue and capacity gains hinge on policy clarity and firmer demand.

items.title: Fujitsu and Nvidia co-develop AI for next‑gen manufacturing
items.summary:
- Fujitsu and Nvidia will co-develop *AI infrastructure* and smart robotics to position Japan as a global manufacturing leader by 2030 and address acute labor shortages.
- They plan to integrate Fujitsu MONAKA CPUs with Nvidia GPUs via NVLink Fusion to power FugakuNEXT‑class systems (~600 exaflops) for industrial AI, digital twins, and real‑time robot perception.
- The deal could become a global model for **humancentric AI** in manufacturing and healthcare, but scaling depends on policy, safety standards, and workforce training.

items.title: NASA and Australia expand cooperation in space and aeronautics
Lego's $1B Chesterfield factory 35% complete
items.summary:
- Lego’s *$1B* Chesterfield, VA factory is *35% complete* after a topping-out, targeting full completion in January 2027 as the company’s first US manufacturing site.
- The 340‑acre, 1.7M sq ft campus of 13 buildings will create about *1,760 jobs* and include molding, packing and warehousing while prioritizing *solar* and carbon‑neutral goals.
- It anchors Lego’s North American network alongside a *$366M* Prince George distribution center to shorten supply chains, speed delivery and boost resilience.
